intro: Cyclosorus megacuspis, commonly known as the giant spike moss, is a species of vascular plant belonging to the family Lephtalioideae. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems and dense clusters of spore-bearing leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. Its reproductive structures are complex, featuring specialized sporophylls that enclose the spores. Cyclosorus megacuspis plays an important ecological role in its habitat by contributing to soil stability and providing microhabitats for various organisms.
